revision.text:
{{Other people2|James E. Boyd (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox Officeholder |name = James E. Boyd |image = James E Boyd Nebraska Governor.jpg |imagesize = |smallimage = |caption = |order = 7th [[List of Governors of Nebraska|Governor of Nebraska]] |term_start = 1891, 1892 |term_end = 1893 |governor = |predecessor = [[John Milton Thayer]] |successor = [[Lorenzo Crounse]] |birth_date = September 9, 1834 |birth_place = [[County Tyrone, Ireland]] |death_date = April 5,1909 |death_place = [[Omaha, Nebraska]] |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] }} '''James Edward Boyd''' (September 9, 1834{{spaced ndash}}April 30, 1906) was an [[Irish people|Irish]]-born American businessman in pioneer [[Omaha, Nebraska]], and a politician. The founder of [[Boyd's Packing House]], he served as the [[List of mayors of Omaha|Mayor]] of Omaha from 1881 to 1883 and from 1885 to 1887, and as the [[List of Governors of Nebraska|seventh Governor]] of the state of [[Nebraska]] in 1891 and from 1892{{spaced ndash}}1893. Boyd was born in [[County Tyrone]], Ireland on September 9, 1834.{{cite web|title=James E. Boyd|url=http://www.nga.org/cms/home/governors/past-governors-bios/page_nebraska/col2-content/main-content-list/title_boyd_james.html|publisher=National Governors Association|accessdate=16 September 2012}} He moved to [[Belmont County, Ohio]], with his family in 1844.{{cite web|title=James E. Boyd|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=rWkP0DM_upwC&pg=PA92&lpg=PA92&dq=nebraska+governor+Robert+Wilkinson+Furnas&source=bl&ots=n5zrZY7rsp&sig=tHM_nvIw7QtKf5cOHDFSzN3KfcQ&hl=en&sa=X&ei=lUxVUOGIHsm_2QXe-oDIBg&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=nebraska%20governor%20Robert%20Wilkinson%20Furnas&f=false|publisher=The Encyclopedia of Nebraska|accessdate=16 September 2012}} His education was in the common schools. As he grew older, he worked as a carpenter and a grocery store clerk. He married Anna Henry on August 22, 1858.[http://www.nebraskahistory.org/lib-arch/research/public/state_governors/boyd.pdf Gov. James E. Boyd papers] at the [[Nebraska State Historical Society]]. Retrieved on 2009-07-06. ==Career== After a move to Omaha, Nebraska Territory, in 1856, he continued to support himself with his carpentry.{{cite web|title=James E. Boyd|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=rWkP0DM_upwC&pg=PA92&lpg=PA92&dq=nebraska+governor+Robert+Wilkinson+Furnas&source=bl&ots=n5zrZY7rsp&sig=tHM_nvIw7QtKf5cOHDFSzN3KfcQ&hl=en&sa=X&ei=lUxVUOGIHsm_2QXe-oDIBg&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=nebraska%20governor%20Robert%20Wilkinson%20Furnas&f=false|publisher=The Encyclopedia of Nebraska|accessdate=16 September 2012}} A member of the [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic Party]], Boyd served in the [[Nebraska House of Representatives]] in 1866.http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/boyd.html Boyd was mayor of [[Omaha, Nebraska]] from 1881 to 1883, and from 1885 to 1887. He was the first Democrat elected as Nebraska's governor and served in that position in 1891, and from 1892 to 1893.{{cite web|title=James E. Boyd|url=http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/boyd.html|publisher=The Political Graveyard|accessdate=16 September 2012}} ==Death and legacy== Boyd died in Omaha, Nebraska on April 30, 1906, and he is interred at Forest Lawn Memorial Park, Omaha, Douglas County, Nebraska USA.{{cite web|title=James E. Boyd|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=13070|publisher=Find A Grave|accessdate=16 September 2012}} [[Boyd County, Nebraska]] is named after Boyd.{{cite web|url= http://www.epodunk.com/cgi-bin/genInfo.php?locIndex=22365|title=Profile for Boyd County, Nebraska, NE|publisher= education.com|accessdate= September 29, 2012}} From 1885 to 1890, Boyd's portrait was painted in Omaha by artist [[Herbert A. Collins]].Biography of Herbert Alexander Collins, by Alfred W. Collins, February 1975, 4 pages typed, in the possession of Collins' great-great grand-daughter, D. Dahl of Tacoma, WA ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} {{Portal|Biography}} *[http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=13070 Find-A-Grave] *[http://www.nga.org/cms/home/governors/past-governors-bios/page_nebraska/col2-content/main-content-list/title_boyd_james.html National Governors Association] *[http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/boyd.html|publisher=The Political Graveyard]

Broatch]] | years=1885{{spaced ndash}}1887}} {{succession box | before=[[John Milton Thayer]] |title=[[List of Governors of Nebraska|Governor of Nebraska]] | after=John Milton Thayer | years=1891}} {{succession box | before=John Milton Thayer |title=[[List of Governors of Nebraska|Governor of Nebraska]] | after=[[Lorenzo Crounse]] | years=1892{{spaced ndash}}1893}} {{S-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=16891240}} {{Persondata | NAME = Boyd, James E. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = September 9, 1834 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = April 30, 1906 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Boyd, James E.}} [[Category:1834 births]] [[Category:1906 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the Nebraska House of Representatives]] [[Category:Governors of Nebraska]] [[Category:People from Omaha, Nebraska]] [[Category:Mayors of Omaha, Nebraska]] [[Category:Irish emigrants to the United States (before 1923)]] [[Category:Meatpacking industry in Omaha, Nebraska]]
